snippet: For generations, evidence at crime scenes has been collected in ways to reduce contamination. Now, under a proposal in New York State, similar care would be taken to gather the memories of witnesses.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column describes proposal put forward by coalition of New York State Bar Association, District Attorneys Association of New York and Innocence Project that aims to reduce number of wrongful convictions in state; proposal includes changes in police procedures so that eyewitness testimony and confessions would be treated with same care and precaution used for physical evidence.
lead_paragraph: For generations, evidence at crime scenes has been collected in ways to reduce contamination. Now, under a proposal in New York State, similar care would be taken to gather the memories of witnesses.

headline.print_headline: A Plan to Combat Mistaken Identifications and False Confessions
